name: Pierceâ€“Birkhoff conjecture
rephrased: Any function that is piecewise defined by polynomials can be expressed as the maximum over a finite set of minima, where each minimum is taken over a finite set of polynomials.
implication_form: If a function is piecewise-polynomial, then it can be expressed as the maximum of finite minima of finite collections of polynomials.
posed_by: Garrett Birkhoff and Richard S. Pierce (initially stated informally), Melvin Henriksen and John R. Isbell (formalized the rigorous statement)
explained: The Pierce-Birkhoff conjecture, formulated in the context of lattice-ordered rings (l-rings) or f-rings, states that any piecewise-polynomial function defined on a compact interval (typically [0,1]) can be expressed as the supremum (maximum) of a finite collection of infima (minima) of finite collections of polynomials.
related_conjectures: Skolem Problem (Note: While both are conjectures in mathematics, the Skolem Problem is unrelated to the Pierce-Birkhoff conjecture and pertains to linear recurrence sequences.)
